reviews.review_msg: Dr. Coley's lectures are very enjoyable but the material is very confusing as well as the assignments. He just asks you to write essays but doesn't really teach you how to write an essay or what he is looking for.
Professor Coley was great! His lectures were enjoyable. You will be good as long as you do your readings, as it will be easier to understand the course material and help writing essays!

His lectures are INTERESTING for a 9:30am class. He is funny and always there to help you after class. You can see he loves what he teaches. He's the best prof I had till date! Would definitely take any course he teaches if it's in my requirement.
Very good prof, lectures usually capture the main idea from what you missed, if you miss any readings. Didn't like poetry, and still don't but Coley made it tolerable.
amazing, icon, so approachable and nice and very articulate and knowledgeable. lectures are so engaging and he speaks with clarity and he's so funny would take this class again.

I loved Coley! I only took this class as it was one of the only ones left since I registered late, but I don't regret it at all! Coley made me take interest in poetry as his lectures are very entertaining and easy to follow along. As someone who hates writing/English classes he made it fun and worthwhile. Would totally recommend!!!

David Coley made lectures very engaging and enjoyable along with providing helpful resources for the readings (make sure you keep up with them). Overall a very enjoyable experience as a 1st year student.

One of the best professors ever! Hes funny and enthusiastic about what he teaches, which is contagious. You do need to read for class, but he goes through the material in class. Attending the tutorials is mandatory. The lectures were always fun to go to, and he made it engaging.

Corey did an amazing job TA'ing ENG 115. Corey came well prepared and got the most out of a tutorial that was shy and seldom participated, and did quite a few audibles when needed. He was well accessible outside of class and gave great advice re: papers. Good guy and wouldn't hesitate to recommend.

Easy course, only showed up to class a few times and finished with an A-. Not a fan of literature but the novels were actually very interesting. Professor Fleming gave VERY clear criteria for assignments so you knew exactly what you needed to do. He even provided us with all of the questions for the final so it really just depends on your TA.
Great prof, energetic and articulate, breaks things down well and has clear and fair grading criteria.

I finish my degree this year and looking back I can say that Lesjak was the most boring waste of time. Lectures were her opinions about the readings. She could be very unprofessional. She started class one day complaining about her teenage daughter, called her "a flake" and said "teenagers are the Devil" (I was a teenager when I took the class).

Lesjak loves the subject matter. I loved the intertwining of critical race tenets, patriarchal relations and gendered discourse that her selection of literature entailed. However, I found her lectures dragged on, and that I learned very little, perhaps due to my lack of interest in English. Yet she was very cheerful, and I can see her appeal.

Carolyn is a truly amazing professor. She cares immensely about her students and is truly passionate about what she teaches. She makes lectures interesting, is personable and often hilarious as well. She gives incredible feedback on assignments and is always willing to help you improve. I would highly recommend her if you're willing to work hard.
Great guy in and out of the classroom. His lectures are enjoyable to sit through, and are very helpful in getting to understand the material.

This is the second English course I have taken at SFU and let me just say this prof was amazing. I truly enjoyed her lectures, as they were not excessively long and they were straight to the point. Also, she was extremely helpful through email if you ever had any questions.
